column5: Im going up in two weeks, what are the road conditions like? Is the 502 still open to daytime only, and are there any construction areas?

Just traveled 502 on 7/3. They are installing several culverts along the northern half of 502 with a 2-3 flag stops. It appears they are making an attempt to allow the water to flow through in case of a repeat of the heavy rains they experienced in June. There were limited delays and we made good time. Did take a blast to the windshield from a rock and will be replacing this week. Only downfall to what was a tremendous trip.
I just came down 502 this AM, it has some rough spots, construction in areas, gravel patches ect, is open 24/7. It is still much faster than hwy 71.
Thanks for the info, especially the 24/7 as we go up in the middle of the night and I had heard it was closed to night traffic at one point in time. Later, Jay
Saw a couple of Moose carcasses on the way up 502 if driving at night be extremly careful as these beasts can put a hurting on a rig.Zugbug
